text:
We would like to retrieve the date when a marketing email was sent. I just wanted to double check if the following would be the best way to get this information. We should use Marketing Email API and from there we should retrieve following data for this:

"publishDate": 1514293429917,
// Integer; the timestamp in milliseconds that the email has been published at, or scheduled to send at.

This should provide the date when the marketing email was sent as sent is the same thing as published, right??

Source for this is documentation page: *<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/lists/marketing-email-overview>*
I'm not sure how to implement this on microsoft flow
As the flow is called every time so a delay would not work as each flow would get delayed until the same time

Hey folks,
Can anyone guide me where to find more information about scopes in api besides this article?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/working-with-oauth#scopes>

I’m trying to learn more about profile scope. Unfortunately, it’s not mentioned in the documentation above.
If anyone have something on this please share with me. Thanks!
hy... I need I help... I need to create owner dropdown property with api properties

If I change the fieldType for select, the error is:
{
  "status": "error",
  "message": "Property 'aaaaa' has no options but options are required!",
  "correlationId": "8080eb10-70be-4b60-ba22-a8ca5ed77f5a",
  "propertiesErrorCode": "PROPERTY_INVALID"
}
how I create a owner property?
<@U019NUUDZUY> I believe the Owner property lists your HubSpot users and is not editable via the API. Someone else can jump in here and correct me if I am wrong.
<@U01C87PNTDE> At v2 api I can create a owner property, at v3 no... We cant to create that property type in v3 or its a bug?
im not sure, i still us the v2 until they get v3 up and fully running. if you can do it via v2, then by all means use the v2 endpoint
Yeah, sometimes I use v3, but I also still use the v2
even I can create these properties on custom objects also through v2
